title: Metacognitive Accuracy-Based Reward Learning Design: Language Education Course for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Exploration of educational applications of reward systems utilizing pre-service teachers' metacognitive monitoring abilities

learning_goals: Learners can construct a model explaining the relationship between metacognitive prediction accuracy and actual learning outcomes.
Preservice teachers can design a metacognition-based reward system for language learning tasks and achieve over 80% suitability.
Participants can apply the instructional design developed through project-based assessment to real educational simulations, improving learning effectiveness by over 20%.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
